hero.question: Will the DHS shutdown end after March 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: The 10-point jump to 53% suggests Democrats are betting the shutdown gets resolved before the deadline, probably pricing in a last-minute deal as we approach April. The real tell is volume at $471K: that's thin enough that smart money likely sees this closer to 60-65%, meaning anyone fading the panic buyers right now has edge.

daily_take.headline: DHS Shutdown Odds Spike 10pts. Market Pricing in Real Escalation Risk.
daily_take.deck: DHS shutdown resolution odds jumped to 52.9% in 24 hours, signaling fresh headlines shifted dealer positioning. The market just flipped from "shutdown probably ends" to "toss-up," and that move is real. Smart money should check what's actually happening in Congress before chasing the bounce, because a 10-point swing on political binary usually means either smart conviction or panic buying.

sidebar.headline: Colombia's president at 95.5% is a sucker bet getting hammered. Odds this extreme on any political figure signal the market priced in a worst case that probably won't happen.
sidebar.label: Colombian President Out: 95.5%

sidebar.headline: FUT surged 16pts in 24h on Counter-Strike odds. Check if this is sharp esports money or retail chasing heat before the match.
sidebar.label: FUT vs M80 (BO3): 69.5%

sidebar.headline: Anduril IPO odds crashed 22pts off highs. Either funding conditions tightened or the market got ahead of itself on defense-tech momentum. Worth tracking if this is repricing or panic.
sidebar.label: Anduril IPO Before 2027: 31.5%
